children.name: when people write, speak etc to each other
communication
children.definition: the activity or process of speaking, writing, or sending messages to other people: sự giao tiếp, giao tế
examples: a course on communication skills
communication between
There's very little communicationbetweenmother and daughter (= they do not have a good relationship) .

children.name: a means of communication
children.definition: a way of exchanging information
examples: There were no roads and no means of communication with the people in the mountains.

children.name: a line/channel of communication
children.definition: a way of exchanging information, especially in an organization
examples: It's important to maintain good lines of communication between managers and staff.

children.name: a form/method/system of communication
children.definition: something you use to exchange information
examples: At university, lectures are the main form of communication.

children.name: a medium of communication
children.definition: a way of exchanging information, especially through televison, art, music etc
examples: Photography is a very popular medium of communication.

children.name: a lack of communication
examples: Disagreements are often due to a lack of communication.

children.name: a breakdown in communication
children.definition: a failure
examples: Differences in language and traditions can lead to a breakdown in communication.

children.name: good communication
examples: In our company, there is good communication between the various departments.

children.name: poor communication
examples: There was poor communication between the air traffic controllers and the aircraft.

children.name: effective communication
examples: Effective communication plays a key role in the democratic process.

children.name: direct communication
examples: The new system allows more direct communication between teachers and parents.

children.name: open communication
children.definition: involving everyone in a group
examples: The system is aimed at creating trust and open communication.

children.name: mass communication
children.definition: involving many people in a country, the world etc
examples: Television, radio and other forms of mass communication have made the world a global village.

children.name: human communication
examples: Speech is the most effective method of human communication.

children.name: verbal communication
children.definition: with words
examples: This activity is designed to improve students' verbal communication skills.

children.name: non-verbal communication
children.definition: without words
examples: Your appearance and movements are both forms of non-verbal communication.

children.name: electronic communication
children.definition: using computers
examples: Electronic communication encourages more information exchange.

children.name: two-way communication
children.definition: in both directions
examples: Train drivers need two-way communication with the signal box at all times.

children.name: establish communication
examples: My job is to establish good communication with our hotel guests.

children.name: facilitate communication
children.definition: make it easier
examples: Computers have facilitated global communication.

children.name: communication skills
examples: Most managers in business spend some time learning communication skills, so that they and their staff can understand each other.

children.name: a communication system
examples: The natural communication system for humans is speech.

children.name: contact
children.definition: communication between two people or groups - use this especially when you are talking about people who do not speak to each other very often: liên lạc

children.name: have contact with somebody
examples: I haven’t had any contact with her for at least two years.

children.name: be in contact
children.definition: have regular communication
examples: He’s been in contact with his lawyer about the situation.

children.name: get in contact
children.definition: manage to communicate
examples: Where can I get in contact with you while you are away?

children.name: stay/keep in contact
children.definition: alsomaintain contactformal
examples: We’ve stayed in contact since we met on holiday.

children.name: lose contact
children.definition: no longer see someone or hear from them
examples: She went to live in Australia and I lost contact with her.

children.name: make contact
examples: We’d like to make contact with other schools in the area.

children.name: put somebody in contact with somebody
children.definition: give someone the name, telephone number etc of another person
examples: I can put you in contact with a friend of mine in Paris.

children.name: come into contact with somebody
children.definition: meet or spend time with somebody
examples: It’s good to come into contact with people from different cultures.

children.name: bring somebody into contact with somebody
examples: The job brought me into contact with a lot of interesting people.

children.name: establish contact
examples: The police are trying to establish contact with the kidnappers.

children.name: avoid contact
examples: She doesn’t give interviews and avoids contact with the media.

children.name: sever contact with somebody
children.definition: refuse to have any contact with someone
examples: After the divorce, she severed all contact with her husband.

children.name: direct contact
children.definition: spending time with somebody
examples: Our volunteers work in direct contact with people who need help.

children.name: close contact
children.definition: communicating with somebody often
examples: I like to stay in close contact with my parents.

children.name: personal contact
children.definition: seeing and speaking to somebody personally
examples: She never comes into personal contact with senior managers.

children.name: social/human contact
children.definition: spending time with other people
examples: He lived alone and had little human contact.

children.name: regular contact
examples: All students have regular contact with their tutor.

children.name: day-to-day/daily contact
examples: I like my job because it involves day-to-day contact with clients.

children.name: face-to-face contact
children.definition: talking to someone who is with you
examples: Certain types of jobs do not need face-to-face contact.

children.name: one-to-one contact
children.definition: being with only one other person
examples: Children with learning difficulties may need one-to-one contact.

children.name: radio contact
children.definition: communication by radio
examples: Air traffic control had lost radio contact with the pilot.

children.name: contact with/between
examples: There is very little contact between the two tribes.
Many of us have no direct contact with elderly people.

children.name: in contact
examples: We stay in contact by email.
The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.

children.name: to no longer speak to or write to sb
lose touch
children.definition: to not speak to, write to, or see sb for a long time, so that finally you do not know where they are or what they are doing: mất liên lạc, lâu không liên hệ
examples: It’s sad, but Wendy and I have lost touch.

children.name: lose touch with
examples: After Jason moved to Utah, I lost touch with him.
We lost touch over the years.

children.name: to regularly telephone, write to, email etc sb
be in contact
children.definition: to regularly telephone, write to, email etc sb so that you quickly find out about any news:
examples: Harrison maintains that the pair were not in contact for over 10 years.

children.name: be in contact with
examples: We’re in close contact with the Italian division of the company.
John is no longer in contact with his family.

children.name: keep in touch
children.definition: / stay in touch to continue to see, speak to, or write to sb when you are no longer working with them, living near them etc: giữ liên lạc
examples: ▪ Linda and I stay in touch by sending occasional postcards.
▪ Have a safe trip back. Don’t forget to keep in touch.
▪ I met Pia in Sweden and we’ve stayed in touch ever since.

children.name: keep in touch/stay in touch with
examples: ▪ I haven’t kept in touch with any of the people I went to school with.
▪ Do you keep in touch with any of your friends from school?

children.name: keep in contact
children.definition: to continue to write to, telephone, email etc sb although you are far away from them: giữ liên lạc
examples: ▪ We keep in contact, but I rarely see them.

children.name: keep in contact with
examples: ▪ I’ve kept in contact with several of my army buddies.

children.name: keep in contact by
examples: ▪ Teenagers keep in contact by text messaging on their mobile phones.

children.name: communicate
children.definition: to exchange information or have a conversation with sb, by telephone, letter etc, or by seeing them: giao tiếp, liên hệ
examples: As an actor he could communicate a whole range of emotions.

children.name: communicate to sb
examples: Has the news been communicated to the staff yet?

children.name: communicate sth to sb
examples: The decision was communicated to our staff late in 1998.

children.name: communicate with
examples: People use more than words when they communicate with each other.
We can now communicate instantlywithpeople on the other side of the world.
Unable to speak a word of the language, he communicatedwith(= using) his hands.

children.name: communicate by phone/email/letter etc
examples: Now that we live in different cities, we communicate by e-mail.

children.name: communicate in writing
examples: They couldn’t communicate in writing, because William was illiterate.

children.name: to write to, talk to, telephone etc sb
get in touch with
children.definition: sb to write to, telephone, email etc sb, especially sb you do not see very often: liên lạc với
examples: I really ought to get in touch with Paula. It’s been months since we last spoke.
I’ve been trying to get in touch with my sister for several days.
You can get in touch with me at home, or at the office if necessary.

children.name: contact
children.definition: to write to, phone, email etc sb especially for the first time, in order to give or ask for information: liên lạc, liên hệ
examples: I was given the names of three government officials to contact.
After they received the bomb threat, school officials immediately contacted the police.
Elsa contacted several companies to ask if they could offer her part-time work.
If the problem continues, try contacting a software expert.
Give the names of two people who can be contacted in an emergency.
Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
You can contact me UKon/ USat(= speak to me by telephoning) 388 9146.

children.name: get onto
children.partOfSpeech: [T phrasal verb not usually in prog]
children.definition: UK spoken to phone, write to, email etc sb in order to complain, explain, or ask for sth: liên lạc
examples: I’m afraid I can’t help you. You’d better get onto the foreign office.
I’ll get onto Eddy and see if I can find out what’s going on.

children.name: approach
children.definition: to contact sb that you do not know or have not contacted before, in order to offer them sth or ask them for sth: liện lạc , liên hệ
examples: Nash has already been approached by several pro football teams.

children.name: approach sb about sth
examples: The company confirmed that it had been approached about a merger.

children.name: make contact with
children.definition: to succeed in contacting sb, especially when this is difficult: liên lạc được với
examples: The pilot finally managed to make contact with the control tower.
I’ve managed to make contact with most of the people on the list.

children.name: communicate
children.definition: to express your thoughts and feelings clearly, so that other people understand them →convey:
examples: The course is designed to enable people to communicate effectively in speech and writing.
She’s clever, but she can’t communicate her ideas.
A baby communicates its needs by crying.
communication[U]
Lack of communication, not lack of caring, often causes marriages to break up.

children.name: communicate with
examples: Many parents find it difficult to communicate with their teenage sons or daughters.
I find I just can't communicatewithher.

children.name: communicate sth to sb
examples: Without meaning to, she communicated her anxiety to her child.
His enthusiasmcommunicated itselfto the voters.
A teacher must be able tocommunicate effectivelyto students.
